verses.roman:
sei siṁha vasuk jīvera hṛdaya-kandare
kalmaṣa-dvirada nāśe yāṅhāra huṅkāre

synonyms: sei—that; siṁha—lion; vasuk—let Him sit; jīvera—of the living entities; hṛdaya—of the heart; kandare—in the cavern; kalmaṣa—of sins; dvi-rada—the elephant; nāśe—destroys; yāṅhāra—of whom; huṅkāre—the roar.
translation: May that lion be seated in the core of the heart of every living being. Thus with His resounding roar may He drive away one's elephantine vices.
